p: Puerarin is an isoflavone with phytoestrogenic potential, which can be found in the roots of Pueraria spp. In rat models with endometriosis, was performed oral gavage with puerarin, and the results were evaluated four weeks after the administration. The weight of the ectopic endometrial tissue and the estrogen levels were significantly decreased in the study group in comparison to controls. These pieces of evidence demonstrated that puerarin is able to suppress the development and growth of endometriosis [ 115].
